elements.title: Marie Antoinette with a Rose (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Marie Antoinette with a Rose (pictured) by Élisabeth Vigée Le Brun was a Salon exhibition replacement for her criticized portrait of the queen wearing a chemise?

elements.title: Arden Warner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that particle physicist Arden Warner invented a magnetism-based method for cleaning up oil spills?

elements.title: Waeapo River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that thousands of political prisoners in Indonesia were interned in the Waeapo River valley in Buru?

elements.title: Linda Watson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Linda Watson, a dramatic soprano born in San Francisco who made a career in Europe, is proud of a Grammy nomination for Wagner's Ring cycle with her as Brünnhilde?

elements.title: Gavrilița Cabinet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after appointing the Gavrilița Cabinet, Moldova is only one of two republics in the world where the non-collective head of state and head of government are both currently women?

elements.title: Natalie Simanowski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Natalie Simanowski began her "second life" as a Paralympian cyclist after being attacked by someone described as a "psychopath"?

elements.title: Bicellariella ciliata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bicellariella ciliata, Crisularia plumosa, Bugulina flabellata and Bugulina turbinata form part of a bryozoan "turf" on steep or vertical rock exposed to moderate water movement?

elements.title: Rosa Egipcíaca (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rosa Egipcíaca was the first black woman in Brazil to write a book?
